+Jonathan Sim: Magic That one is easier to answer.  The phones were still down while she was in Scranton, PA, but were repaired sometime while she was on the road.  From PA to IL is at least 12 hours so there'd be plenty of time for the lines to be repaired in that span.  Add that to the fact almost no one had a cell phone in 1990, and voila.

@netweed09Â  There was a TV show in the 80's called MacGyver. A lot of what you saw in Home Alone is what Mac would do to the bad guys, the only difference is that he never planned things out, many of what MacGyver did was on the fly and improvised. Used all kinds of objects to his advantage and make them into an explosive, a trap...etc. pretty much anything to use to either distract or take out the bad guys. When the writers made these Home Alone movies, they used some of the ideas from the show which by the way MacGyver was still on TV when the first Home Alone movie came out. Then recently CBS rebooted the show.

Fun Fact : The whole movie was improvised. Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern just decided to torment Macaulay Culkin in his own home, Culkin decided to kick both their asses. Just then, Chris Columbus was passing by and heard the commotion and he found it all very hilarious, so he decided to video tape it all. But since there was no World Star or Youtube in 1989, he just decided to release it in theaters instead. Not many know this.
